column1: #Text=Dear EditorsAt least this is a much more balanced piece than 'the sky is falling' piece you wrote the other day.Here's my view, sitting here in our homeland, not having a vote in the US.Full democracy, allows us all to do and say what we want (short of hatred and racism).
#Text=My father and uncles, all went to war in WWII to protect that right for all of us today.
#Text=Most people, in both Canada and the US, have family members who did the same, and some who made the ultimate sacrifice.
#Text=That America exercised that right yesterday, and other democratic countries have done the same in the past (I am not a fan of Junior Trudeau) is our best strength.
#Text=As Winston Churchill famously said, \u201CDemocracy is the worst form of government, except for all the others.\u201D.

#Text=None of us have an idea how a Trump Presidency will turn out; but the inescapable fact of the matter is that every American, who wanted to exercise their franchise, had the opportunity yesterday to decide who their President is.

#Text=It wasn\u2019t all that long ago (Aug 6, 1965), that a guy who many people might have expected wouldn\u2019t support universal suffrage, Lyndon Baines Johnson, passed into law for the US, the Voting Rights Act.
#Text=In 4 years, if they don\u2019t like his performance, they get to kick Trump out of office.
#Text=In the meantime, everyone who thinks they are \u201Cpolitically entitled\u201D in the US has a chance to rebuild their favourite system.
#Text=Just as Lech Walesa upset the communist system in Poland, so today has Donald Trump upset the system of political elites in the USA.
#Text=This is healthy; this is growth; and this will keep America as the leader of the free world.
#Text=For a country born of revolution, they have nothing to fear.
#Text=God bless the United States of America.
#Text=There couldn\u2019t be a prouder moment to live there.
